items.title: Start-Ups Use Technology to Redesign the Hiring Process
items.abstract: Algorithms can help remove bias from the traditional résumé-sifting process and level the playing field for applicants.

items.title: All the Rage | Bright, Cheerful Colors at the London Design Festival
items.abstract: This year’s edition of the annual mega-fair found designers using an unexpectedly playful color palette that included a smorgasbord of neons and pastels.

items.title: Design Shows Take On the Future. And It’s Not Pretty.
items.abstract: Museum curators and mindful millennials seek visions of a “clean,” sustainable future. In Philadelphia, designers offer ideas to provoke.

items.title: Unhealthy Foods Aren’t Just Bad For You, They May Also Be Addictive
items.abstract: Food researchers debate whether highly processed foods like potato chips and ice cream are addictive, triggering our brains to overeat.

items.title: Preliminary Notes on Inequality and Urbanism
